Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centres above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (only part ornate body pattern, flank and genitals remaining) to right; part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the bull, see New York Metropolitan Museum of Art 55.71.8, from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 259, no. 500, pl. 66)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0495) (phase 2)
